Global Warming/How do scientists know they are not wrong?/Live Science

May 5th, 2009

http://www.livescience.com/environment/070716_gw_notwrong.html

Hurricane expert William Gray, of Colorado State University, told Discover magazine in a 2005 interview, “I’m not disputing that there has been global warming. There was a lot of global warming in the 1930s and ’40s, and then there was a slight global cooling from the middle ’40s to the early ’70s. And there has been warming since the middle ’70s, especially in the last 10 years. But this is natural, due to ocean circulation changes and other factors. It is not human induced.”’

Blog:

It is typical of the mainstream to accept the theory presented by media.  As critical thinkers, the academics should be more open to hearing both side of the scientific argument.  This one makes sense…its about control and power by government.

“Kudos” to CSU expert William Gray for dissenting on this popular opinion.

Pay cuts? Yes/PE

May 1st, 2009

http://www.pe.com/localnews/opinion/editorials/stories/PE_OpEd_Opinion_S_op_01_ed_legpay1.3eb6db3.html#

“There is no legitimate reason to shield elected state officials from the fiscal pain hitting every other part of state government.  Who better to help bear the costs of the state’s budget crisis than the folks who helped drive state finances into the ditch?”

Blog:

Agreed, but 10% cut is not enough.  Make them work part-time without benefits and stop the perks!

Global warming revisited/Thefreemanonline

April 30th, 2009

http://www.thefreemanonline.org/uncategorized/global-warming-revisited/

“The Medieval Warm Period (800-1300), which took place without SUV’s, power plants, or factories, was warmer than it is today. Contrary to the infallible computer climate-model predictions, global temperatures peaked ten years ago, in 1998.  There was NO appreciable temperature increase for the next eight years.  For the last two years the temperatures have actually fallen.”

“Carbon dioxide will continue to be demonized as a ‘greenhouse gas’.  Even though it is harmless to humans and is needed by all plant life, it will be called a toxic pollutant by the media, militant environmentalists, and politicians.  Yet carbon dioxide makes up less than 4 percent of all greenhouse gases.  Water vapor accounts for 95 percent.”

Blog:

Politicians/lobbyists/academia have a self interest to agree with this media “crisis”…..their wallets.

Government Sets Us Up for the Next Bust/John Stossel/”Give Me a Break”

April 28th, 2009

http://www.thefreemanonline.org/columns/give-me-a-break/government-sets-us-up-for-the-next-bust/

“If an athlete injures himself and suffers great pain, we recognize the shortsightedness of giving him painkillers to keep him going.  The pain might be masked, but at the risk of greater injury later.”

“The way the system is supposed to work is…people fail.  Then the competent people take over the assets from the failed people and then you start again with a new, stronger base.  What we are doing this time is taking the assets from the competent people, giving them to the incompetent and saying, ‘OK now you can compete with the competent people’.  So everybody’s weakened:  The whole nation is weakened, the whole economy is weakened.  That’s not the way it’s supposed to work.”

Blog:

If schools would be allowed to fail in the same manner as businesses, schools overall would improve and those that could not compete would close.  Despite huge sums of taxpayer dollars and talk of increased accountability, through various performance reports, overall there has been little improvement in school performance.

Don’t reward legislators’ incompetence

April 26th, 2009

http://www.pe.com/localnews/opinion/localviews/stories/PE_OpEd_Opinion_S_op_roberson_22_loc.40714bf.html#

“It does not take a rocket scientist to see how poorly the current politicians have messed up this state.  Regardless of whether Props. 1A-1F pass, the state budget will still be in the red, with the deficit growing each day.  Vote NO on all of the ‘get out of jail free cards’ that the current crop of inept politicians have crafted to protect themselves.”

Blog:

The writers of Prop 1A want you to believe that this is a “rainy day fund”.  The truth, if anyone cares about truth, is that Prop 1A extends taxes for another two years.

Don’t believe the smoke and mirrors…read the fine print.
